reviews.review_msg: This instructor was, in my experience, the worst at SFU. Their grading criteria were unclear, feedback provided little guidance, and there seemed to be a bias towards specific students.
Too much work. I had spent at least 10 hours a week for this course. 20+ hours for some weeks, barely slept on weeks of 2-hours long presentation. Good luck if you take it with her.
She doesn't even lecture. Just watches students lecture. Kind of weird that students lecture the professor. However, the professor gets paid to watch and students don't get paid to lecture Irene.

Irene was one of the best professors Ive had at at SFU. This seminar was really engaging and brought out a ton of discussions within the class. She provides a ton of feedback on the research assignment and presentations and provides a fair final Overall great prof and if you put in effort, youll succeed in her class for sure

Must participate even though there's no participation marks. No canvas - sends out all material in email. Hardest final ever as students make the powerpoint and Irene gives ZERO indication of what to study for the final. Research paper has insane requirements such as using Irene's own made up APA style. Paper feedback makes you question your life

She is the opposite of those tags. Going to class was the beginning of her wraith. She will sit and watch students teach and do nothing. Her useless paper with difficult requirements will leave you in tears after you get it back. The final which you dont know how to prepare for, will kick you down to zero confidence if you have any left. Good luck

If you want to spend tuition to hear lectures from students, write a Hilarious research paper with insane and useless requirements, read paper feedback from a prof that is so arrogant and picky, and finally complete open questions but have only one "best" answer in final, Congratulations, you are at the right place.

Irene is old school and does not use a class website. She sends emails frequently with slides and other information, making it difficult to keep things organized. She is a tough grader for the writing assignment. It is more of an English assignment than accounting. Final is brutal as there's only one correct answer per case scenario. 30 MC + 5Writ.
Awesome!!!
Very unorganized. Not willing to help. Doesn't explain the concepts properly. I would recommend not taking it with him.

Professor Hrazdil is a great prof. His assessments are fairly marked. The class is seminar based, so a big part of your grade depends on how well you deliver your seminar. He also gives out 5 surprise quizzes, and they are pretty tough, so make sure you keep up with the readings. Overall, a solid class if you put in the work.
Honestly, he may come off as unapproachable but he's actually a really nice guy. Super straightforward! He will try and give you the best grade he can.

Although he did not teach as much as the seminars are group lead, his assessments were really really fair. He's lets you pick your groups so make sure you pick decent people to work with since half your grade is presentations.
Karel is one of the best profs I've ever hard. The course is difficult but he cares so much about the students and their understanding. Also super funny and entertaining. Highly recommend

Karel, is a great professor and really knows his subject matter but his content was taught as an accounting class where it was focused much more on company valuation and stock ratios rather than understanding the balance sheet of a business. Great guy and very clear with what you need to know for the assessment vs just good to know stuff.

A very passionate professor who loves the subject of accounting. At times, Karel can come off as stand-offish but he really does mean well. He is interested in improving students learning and helping them with hard projects. The presentations are very valuable for practicing presentation skills and allow for a deeper understanding of the material.
Great prof to hangout with after the semester (We went out for dinner) but the course is pretty useless...
He has great passion on teaching. Gave useful feedbacks for students to review on their seminars.

If you are not a native speakers, u will below the average. He is really bad. Do not take with him. Try other prof. He dont know how to teach, he just sit in the class from 1130-2020, and teach nothing. If you want to fail, try to take with him!!!

Took Business 321 and 421 with him. Truly is one of my favourite professor's at SFU. Knows the topic extremely well, and explains clearly what to expect for assignments/exams/papers. Further makes an effort to break down the Student/Teacher barrier which engages students in his class which subsequently helps you understand the course better.
